10 intro to problem solving video 10 of 17 math teacher circle are professional learning community of middle school math teacher and mathematician our goal is to help middle school math teacher confidently incorporate open-ended authentic mathematical problem solving in their teaching a math session is the heart of any math teacher circle meeting a two-hour session typically focus on an interesting and challenging problem that encourages collaboration among participant with varying skill level and background the video on this page is set up a play list of short clip drawn from a complete math teacher circle session the clip correspond to different activity or segment of the session and have been lightly edited to remove some participant work time and bring the overall length to approximately 1 hour 30 minute per play list each play list includes a debriefing session with participant and is linked to relevant resource including mathematical material from our site the play list is primarily geared for those learning how to plan and lead a math session including leadership team of new math teacher circle and people who have been invited to lead a session for the very first time we also anticipate that they will be useful to experienced session leader who want to learn more about a particular session a well a to anyone curious about math teacher circle in this video joshua zucker julia robinson math festival lead a math teacher circle session titled an introduction to problem solving josh present a problem that seems almost impossibly difficult but teacher discover many way to approach it by considering smaller simpler problem this video wa filmed in summer 2014 when 30 mathematician and math teacher from across the country came to a how to run a math teacher circle workshop at the american institute of mathematics in palo alto ca find material for this session here the 1 to 100 problem tom davis and joshua zucker an introduction to problem solving joshua zucker

the reconstruction era and the fragility of democracy in the wake of the civil war american we are faced with the challenge of rebuilding a society that had been divided by slavery and the political upheaval of war the study of this period in american history is essential to the understanding of citizenship and democracy in the united state today facing history ha produced a series of video and accompanying lesson that will introduce a rigorous study of the reconstruction era into american history classroom our video series includes interview with scholar of the reconstruction era who provide insight into this complex history and address question of freedom justice equality and citizenship that are at the heart of the reconstruction we have also developed a complete unit that offer 16 lesson and many primary source document the unit available in print ebook and free pdf will guide student through a deep exploration of the reconstruction era while enhancing their ethical decision-making and capacity for emotional growth

politics influencing the government the medium and special interest group this lesson teach the influence of the medium and interest group in politics and governmental policy student will be introduced to the tradition of first amendment protection of freedom of the press ha played in providing news outlet the ability to criticize the government and politician and how this protection is limited around the world student will then learn about the crucial citizenship responsibility to stay informed a this play an important role in voting student will learn how politician use the medium to push their agenda and campaign and the effect that medium bias play in obtaining objective political opinion student will also learn about public opinion poll and their influence in election and governmental policy this lesson trace the evolution of different form of medium and how more american are getting their news from the internet it also provides an introduction to the concept of propaganda and propaganda technique such a testimonial plain-folks appeal and bandwagon advertising or promotional campaign finally student will learn about watchdog role the medium play in exposing governmental corruption and wrongdoing this lesson also teach student the impact of interest group and the individual role in impacting governmental policy student will learn about the important responsibility that individual play in our democratic republic to run for elected office petition or write to governmental office holder attend political meeting volunteer for campaign make political donation and obviously vote student will be introduced to the creation of public policy and the role that interest group play in developing that policy they will learn about different type of interest group such a business labor union and public interest group example are provided such a the nea national education association naacp greenpeace the nra and now strategy such a lobbying electioneering litigation and publicizing of these interest group are introduced student are provided example such the naacp initiated brown v board of education lawsuit they will learn about the purpose function and potential downside of the lobbying industry

include contemporary narrative account personal memoir song newspaper report a well a cultural philosophical religious and scientiphic document although the history of social and cultural elite group remains important to historian the life of non-elite woman people of color lesbian and gay are also well represented here to present the material a cleanly a possible without complicated hierarchy and cell division this slide show or lesson plan recap the function of living organism and focus on the aspect of growth and repair it explains the basic of dna replication and cell devision it also discus stem cell and their role in growth and the 200 plus cell that we are made from the lesson ha several writing task to evaluate understanding and stretch imagination a to what can be achieved using stem cell there is also a quick fire anagram quiz to check understanding of key word the lesson could be easily differentiated and the stem cell video go into considerable depth to advanced level video material stem cell video and dna replication next generation science standard addressed l 1 a structure and function system of specialized cell within organism help them perform the essential function of life hs-ls 1 -1 all cell contain genetic information in the form of dna molecule gene are region in the dna that contain the instruction that code for the formation of protein which carry out most of the work of cell hs-ls 1 -1 note this disciplinary core idea is also addressed by hs-ls 3 -1 multicellular organism have a hierarchical structural organization in which any one system is made up of numerous part and is itself a component of the next level hs-ls 1 -2 feedback mechanism maintain a living system s internal condition within certain limit and mediate behavior allowing it to remain alive and functional even a external condition change within some range feedback mechanism can encourage through positive feedback or discourage negative feedback what is going on inside the living system hs-ls 1 -3 l 1 b growth and development of organism in multicellular organism individual cell grow and then divide via a process called mitosis thereby allowing the organism to grow the organism begin a a single cell fertilized egg that divide successively to produce many cell with each parent cell passing identical genetic material two variant of each chromosome pair to both daughter cell cellular division and differentiation produce and maintain a complex organism composed of system of tissue and organ that work together to meet the need of the whole organism hs-ls 1 -4

tradition plus technology equal the perfect equation to flip your classroom john choins edmodocon 2015 during his 16-year teaching career john choins ha worked in both public and private school in the waco texas area for the last 11 year he s taught middle school math including algebra to regular and per-ap math student and wa chosen a the 2014-15 teacher of the year on his current campus a strong advocate for using technology to transform the teaching and learning process choins flipped his classroom in 2014 and based on the positive effect vow to never go back to the traditional way of teaching again wonder how a flipped approach can benefit your classroom choins share how he us edmodo to engage student with video practice exercise and photo-based assignment submission with step-by-step instruction you ll see how integrating technology creatively and efficiently add up what inspired you to apply to speak at edmodocon this past year i used edmodo almost every day with my student a a part of flipping my classroom i had never flipped my classroom before and i wa absolutely amazed at what a positive experience it wa for me my student and their parent i want to share my success and my love for edmodo with anyone who will listen when i saw the request for video submission and the opportunity to persent at edmodocon i jumped at the chance to share what i do on a platform that i love what s the one thing you hope people take away from your edmodocon persentation that flipping their classroom is possible it can be done with ease and it can make a huge difference in the education of their student

cell cycle and mitosis powerpoint the power point cover cell cycle g0 g 1 s g 2 and mitosis there are slide for chromosome how mitosis is the driving force behind growth development regeneration and asexual reproduction the power point also present cancer and other disease cause by disrupted cell cycle this is a great lesson for any state texas biology teks 5 science concept the student know how an organism grows and the importance of cell differentiation the student is expected to a describe the stage of the cell cycle including deoxyribonucleic acid dna replication and mitosis and the importance of the cell cycle to the growth of organism d recognize that disruption of the cell cycle lead to disease such a cancer new generation science standard hs-ls 1 -4 use a model to illustrate the role of cellular division mitosis and differentiation in producing and maintaining complex organism [ assessment boundary assessment doe not include specific gene control mechanism or rote memorization of the step of mitosis ] note there is one image and slide included in this presentation that depicts stage of female growth from birth to adulthood this image may need to be deleted prior to use in the general education classroom

matching graph to quadratic equation activity you have several option with this sort student can graph the equation then look for the matching graph or they can take a graph find the matching equation equation are in both standard and vertex form you can also have student match the equation together to work on changing equation from one form to the other this sort can be used if you have the student graph using transformation or if they find the vertex and 4 more point alternate idea and us for graph match equation together vertex to standard have student decide from the graph if the determinate is positive negative or zero student can identify the x-intercepts in order to find the zero of the function student can identify the vertex axis of symmetry minimum or maximum value student can find domain and range this sort matching game ha 4 level only level 4 is included in the free version level 4 set d includes all type of transformation translation reflection and dilation a equal anything this is a combination of the 3 previous set this matching sort is designed to reduce chance of getting it right by guessing the card are very similar for instance 1 card shift to the right 3 another to left 3 another up 3 and another down 3 student must know which direction to shift based on the equation and not because it wa the only one that moved 4 unit also i have switched some value around to make sure student understand where the shift is up or to the right right 2 up 3 or right 3 up 2 you will have a good idea if student understand the concept after they have completed the matching exercise differentiation option each level can be used individually after the lesson on that particular topic translation reflection dilation they can also be used for differentiated instruction a a class you may be on reflection but some student are still struggling with translation so when the class is doing the level 2 sort those student can be completing the level 1 sort a far a everyone is concerned they are completing the same assignment they do not realize that they are working at different level having student work at their own level increase their confidence possible us review station for test math station for student that have completed their work mid-lesson practice end of lesson check for understanding alternative to homework

mastering meaningful sentence a vocabulary lesson the mastering meaningful sentence lesson plan is more than just a simple vocabulary lesson instead is it a dynamic learning experience that engages student not in just memorizing definition but it establishing meaning using vocabulary in context and developing their writing skill in this lesson student learn that meaningful sentence are sentence that tell the reader something about a word and show that the writer understands the meaning of the word a meaningful sentence utilizes context clue to help the reader student will learn about type of context clue and crafting meaningful sentence in this multiple part lesson that includes the use of technology this lesson plan contains an anticipatory set where student explore how they best learn new vocabulary word through a quick write then student are introduced to writing meaningful sentence using the included google presentation a link to make a copy of the google presentation is provided so you can edit and modify to fit your class a pdf of teacher note for delivering the presentation is provided a well a two different handout to help student practice and then create their own meaningful sentence the lesson close with a quick activity on edmodo that allows student to share a meaningful sentence with their small group by teaching student how to craft meaningful sentence out of unknown vocabulary word you can not only improve their vocabulary but increase their use of new word in their writing this lesson can be modified to be used throughout the year for any type of vocabulary study i have had student choose their own unknown word from work of literature and create meaningful sentence and i have also assigned them word i want them to learn either way i have found this to be a great vocabulary activity to increase student engagement and learning

time bump i have provided a link to this game on my google drive a there is the game board game card and a direction page student can play time bump to practice telling time to 5 minute interval this make a great math workstation activity that can be differentiated for student at various level direction for time bump material needed game board game card and 10 token per student student will practice telling time to 5 minute interval using digital and analog clock print both the game board and the game card you can differentiate instruction by only using the digital card or the analog card or the word card when i use this game for review i use all of the card i also allow student to use classroom judy clock to assist with telling time place game card face down student will choose a card and identify the time on the card and then find that time on the game board they will place a token on that spot the next player will go if a spot ha only one token belonging to another player and you have that time on your card you can bump them off once a spot ha 2 token by 1 player that spot becomes frozen and if you land on it you lose a turn play is done when one player us all of their token

combating ebola slideshow and critical thinking activity this sideshow talk about the ebola virus and the different way that is can be combated the idea is to get the student to come up with and justify a strategy to combat the spread of ebola student are to work in group to research and come up with a preventative package that can be used to tackle the outbreak it cover why antibiotic are ineffective for an outbreak of a virus the moral issue of quarantine the importance of hygiene a well a the importance of vaccination and the ethical implication of testing it is effectiveness it will generate significant conversation between group around the value of life and the different standpoint between individual when an epidemic present a threat younger student objective the lesson objective are to reinforce the core concept of infection and disease prevention older student objective the lesson deeper objective is to get student to consider the moral issue around dealing with epidemic on a socio-economic level and also to consider the moral issue of creating and testing a vaccine for such a dangerous disease i used this sideshow several time with age 11-15 and also with my 17 and 18-year-old advanced biologist possible ng standard addressed ets 1 b developing possible solution when evaluating solution it is important to take into account a range of constraint including cost safety reliability and aesthetic and to consider social cultural and environmental impact secondary to hs-ls 4 -6

darwin theory video elesapiens is a collection of digital educational resource in science and the humanity in line with the curriculum for child between 7 and 13 it content combine cartoon and entertainment with quality teaching learning is encouraged through video game experiment and project pbl want more curricular focus of this resource darwin and his theory animation video explaining in simple language and through powerful visual communication the key concept linked to darwin ` s most famous theory the origin of specie through natural selection encourages student to formulate question and do research on their own content related transversally to concept posed in other unit ng alignment l 3 -1 analyze and interpret data to provide evidence that plant and animal have trait inherited from parent and that variation of these trait exists in a group of similar organism l 3 -2 use evidence to support the explanation that trait can be influenced by the environment l 4 -1 analyze and interpret data from fossil to provide evidence of the organism and the environment in which they lived long ago l 4 -2 use evidence to construct an explanation for how the variation in characteristic among individual of the same specie may provide advantage in surviving finding mate and reproducing l 4 -3 construct an argument with evidence that in a particular habitat some organism can survive well some survive le well and some can not survive at all ms- l 4 -4 construct an explanation based on evidence that describes how genetic variation of trait in a population increase some individual probability of surviving and reproducing in a specific environment ms- l 4 -6 use mathematical representation to support explanation of how natural selection may lead to increase and decrease of specific trait in population over time

student desk reinforcement grid this resource includes 1 desk reinforcement grid 1 individual student that can be used alongside my other spotlight resource token economy data collection form this resource is great for behavior management in the classroom a a district behavior coach and former school-based behavior specialist i relied on token economy to support behavior change with student in general education and special education setting a token economy system is designed to reinforce student acquisition of new positive or appropriate behavior typically the design of a token economy system begin with administering a reinforcement survey or interviewing the student to determine preferred reinforcer token such a sticker coin visual icon of favorite cartoon character or superheroes are created and used with a token grid such a the example provided the student is then taught the behavior s required to earn the token the behavior must be clearly communicated to the student it is best to display the appropriate behavior in both word and picture a a visual reminder of the behavior expectation s you can also write the behavior on the token grid when a specified number of token have been earned the student is able to buy or exchange the earned token for their preferred reinforcer when token economy are implemented effectively they are a strong motivator for behavior change i do not include a loss of token in the system i use

popsicle place value math game popsicle place value math game this is a hand on math game to help reinforce place value this game will require the user to obtain popsicle stick and a bingo dauber from the dollar store this game can be made for le than $ 5 detail are included for creating this game the student will a read write and identify the place value of each digit in a 2 or 3 digit numeral using numeration model c compare two whole number between 0 and 999 using symbol or equal and word greater than le than or equal to essential understanding for student all student should understand the ten-to-one relationship of one ten and hundred 10 one equal 1 ten 10 ten equal 1 hundred understand that number are written to show how many hundred ten and one are in the number understand that knowledge of place value is essential when comparing number understand the relative magnitude of number by comparing number compare two number between 0 and 999 represented pictorially or with concrete object e g base-10 block using the word greater than le than or equal to compare the numerical value of two whole number between 0 and 999 by identifying one a greater than le than or equal to the other write the symbol for le than greater than and equal to equal to compare two number between 0 and 999

ebola a complex problem the ebola outbreak in west africa ha inspired widespread fear throughout the you s and in many other country in reality the threat of ebola is actually quite small with only 1 700 death since 1976 the rarity of the ebola virus ha given major pharmaceutical company very little incentive to develop a treatment for the virus given that the market for such a drug would be almost inexistent however biocryst pharmaceutical a small pharmaceutical company based in frederick md ha been given government help to develop a cure for the virus listen to learn more about the complexity of the ebola virus and what is being done to develop a cure about this resource this resource feature a real world public radio story listening comprehension question and classroom discussion theme about listen current listen current make it easy to bring authentic voice and compelling non-fiction story to the classroom we curate the best of public radio to keep teaching connected to the real world and build student listening skill at the same time for more information and teaching idea
